I love naruto, but its obviously sasuke. There really isnt as many characters comparable to him where you watch him truly transform, regress and completely change as a character good and bad in such a believable way, people are so critical but forget sasuke is legit 16-18 and is dealing with some of the most traumatic revelations in the series. Bro is naruto's best written character as far as I'm considered so its not really a contest when naruto is more or less a flat character that influences the world around him and goes through slight changes of thought about the world but more or less keeps his same ideals from beginning to end.

Oh yes the content and story mhm, please explain to me how in the moro arc or anything prior led up to beast? Please explain to me what beast is, where it derives from besides "muh endless potential", please since you keep parroting the "well gohans always had potential sooo it makes sense huhu", you haven't made a single point besides that.

You're actually slow, this is why its pointless to argue with db fans they will ignore any criticism, eat whatever slop, and call it peak. I promise you I am a more informed dragonball fan then you will ever be, doesn't change the fact that this form is bs and you could not even explain it to me without pulling headcanon out of your ass.

What work? Theyve reused this plot device 3 times in the series, what work? He forgets how to use his powers every arc, that is not "training offscreen" that is bs writing to then have him ascend to whatever beast even is just cause piccolo was getting punched by cell max. They frame it identical to his ssj2 transformation, not even hiding its just a callback bs form thats now above ui because sure, no buildup, no working towards anything, he just farts it out when 30 minutes before in the movie he couldnt even sense piccolos ki.

Haha this is what i mean, youll never actually address this bs with gohan, its just "well actually, that only happened in the rof saga", yeah he definetely didnt have to reawaken ultimate in the t.o.p saga even though he was 'training with piccolo' offscreen, and he DEFINETELY didnt need to reawaken his forms AGAIN with piccolo pretending to hurt pan to get him mad in superhero, no no this was all before superhero, sure dummy.

That training excuse doesnt work when everytime we see gohan, hes "gotten rusty" "cant sense ki" "I dont know if i could even turn super saiyan" hurdur, like he cant be seriously training offscreen if he loses all his battle sense the next time we see him. And im tired of people saying gohans always been like that, no he hasnt, huge potential? Yes, but it was actually well written and had to be honed, not pulled out as a bingo card whenever we need gohan to go from not even remembering how to go ssj to ultra instinct+ level just cause he sees piccolo getting smacked by cell max, like hes never seen piccolo get beat up in a fight before or something. It is bad writing but supertards will go through the biggest loops to make it make sense before just admitting it.

Gohan, he didnt earn the form or get it in a way that makes a microscopic amount of sense. 

Also it looks dumb, visually his is the only one that just doesnt look right on him in the lineup.
Its not a modifier, the point is his modifier was not decided on yet, hence why hes a constellation with no name
Its so funny how many people in this sub literally havent read the source material, its kim dokja people cmon, they dont make it a mystery. He didnt have a modifier at this point.

Boruto's not a masterpiece or anything but its better and fresher than people give it credit for.

Its the kind of game i technically cannot call bad but I genuinely look at everything about it as an overall miss and just wasted potential. It was fun, but it was this close to being a memorable chapter and not a forgettable game if the story wasnt ass, if the side content, characters, and especially beginning portion of the game wasnt so weak, etc. etc., but the gameplay and web swinging is truly top notch. But again, whats good gameplay if theres nothing to do with it beside a couple of generic crime stops that are less varried than the two previous games after completing the story

For the people saying dragonball z, i would genuinely recommend to try kai if you havent already. Its the version I recommend to anyone trying to get into it, all the fat cut out, a much better dub and the only people that will try to suade you away from it are people thatve grown up with Z. Im sorry but the average grown person is not trying to sit through nothing but screaming and one movement happening over an episode. Dbz is great but its padding and old dub makes it unwatchable if you havent grown up with it imo. Kai is as perfect of a recut as you can get with all the action and story given to you, no breaks, no filler.

One piece, I truly cant fathom how people treat it like cinema and a must watch, the first few hundred episodes are literally baby's first anime and if youve seen better, its not going to impress/engage you whatsoever imo. I promise I wanted to like it, but it genuinely felt like I was fighting to sit through ts and not do anything else.
